static ResourceMgr * getInstance ()
 Gets the instance of the ResourceMgr object.

Detailed Description

File for the resourceMgr.

This will take care of all the loading and playing/drawing of sound, music, image, and font files that are used for the program.

Member Function Documentation

void ResourceMgr::deleteAllFonts (  ) 

Frees all loaded fonts from memory.

This will unload all the loaded fonts from memory. Any want to draw text after this requires reloading the fonts using the loadFont function.

void ResourceMgr::deleteAllImages (  ) 

Frees all loaded images from memory.

This will unload all the loaded images from memory. Any want to draw images after this requires reloading the sounds using the loadImage function.

void ResourceMgr::deleteAllMusic (  ) 

Frees all loaded music from memory.

This will unload all the loaded music from memory. Any want to play music after this requires reloading music using the loadMusic function.

void ResourceMgr::deleteAllSounds (  ) 

Frees all loaded sounds from memory.

This will unload all the loaded sounds from memory. Any want to play sounds after this requires reloading the sounds using the loadSound function.

void ResourceMgr::deleteFont ( string  alias  ) 

Frees a specific font from memory.

This will unload the font that matches the given alias from memory. Any want to draw with this font afterward requires reloading it using loadFont.

Parameters:
alias The name that references the font file. Should match the alias that was passed in during loadFont for that font.

void ResourceMgr::deleteImage ( string  alias  ) 

Frees a specific image from memory.

This will unload the image that matches the given alias from memory. Any want to draw this image afterward requires reloading it using loadImage.

Parameters:
alias The name that references the image file. Should match the alias that was passed in during loadImage for that image.

void ResourceMgr::deleteMusic ( string  alias  ) 

Frees a specific music from memory.

This will unload the music that matches the given alias from memory. Any want to play this music afterward requires reloading it using loadMusic.

Parameters:
alias The name that references the music file. Should match the alias that was passed in during loadMusic for that music.

void ResourceMgr::deleteSound ( string  alias  ) 

Frees a specific sound from memory.

This will unload the sound that matches the given alias from memory. Any want to play this sound afterward requires reloading it using loadSound.

Parameters:
alias The name that references the sound file. Should match the alias that was passed in during loadSound for that sound.

void ResourceMgr::drawImage ( string  alias,
double  angle,
double  leftX,
double  rightX,
double  lowerY,
double  upperY,
double  leftX_TexCoord,
double  rightX_TexCoord,
double  lowerY_TexCoord,
double  upperY_TexCoord 
)

Draws a section of an image on the screen to the given coordinates and rotated by a given angle.

Draws a section of a image that cooresponds to the given alias in the rectangle specified by the given coordinates and rotated by the given angle amount. The way the section of image is secified is through percentages along the x and y coordinates of the image.

Parameters:
alias The alias that cooresponds the desired image to draw.
angle The angle amount the image will be rotated. Expressed in degrees.
leftX The left x coordinate of the rectangle the image will be drawn in.
rightX The right x coordinate of the rectangle the image will be drawn in.
lowerY The lower y coordinate of the rectangle the image will be drawn in.
upperY The upper y coordinate of the rectangle the image will be drawn in.
leftX_TexCoord The left x percentage starting point of the section of image that is desired to be drawn. 0.0 means the far left of the texture, 1.0 means the far right, 0.5 means the middle. Texture wrapping is allowed so values like 1.5 and -0.25 are applicable.
rightX_TexCoord The right x percentage ending point of the section of image that is desired to be drawn. 0.0 means the far left of the texture, 1.0 means the far right, 0.5 means the middle. Texture wrapping is allowed so values like 1.5 and -0.25 are applicable.
lowerY_TexCoord The lower y percentage starting point of the section of image that is desired to be drawn. 0.0 means the bottom of the texture, 1.0 means the top, 0.5 means the middle. Texture wrapping is allowed so values like 1.5 and -0.25 are applicable.
upperY_TexCoord The upper y percentage ending point of the section of image that is desired to be drawn. 0.0 means the bottom of the texture, 1.0 means the top, 0.5 means the middle. Texture wrapping is allowed so values like 1.5 and -0.25 are applicable.

double  leftX,
double  rightX,
double  leftY,
double  upperY,
double  leftX_TexCoord,
double  rightX_TexCoord,
double  lowerY_TexCoord,

Parameters:

leftX The left x coordinate of the rectangle the image will be drawn in.
rightX The right x coordinate of the rectangle the image will be drawn in.
lowerY The lower y coordinate of the rectangle the image will be drawn in.
upperY The upper y coordinate of the rectangle the image will be drawn in.
leftX_TexCoord The left x percentage starting point of the section of image that is desired to be drawn. 0.0 means the far left of the texture, 1.0 means the far right, 0.5 means the middle. Texture wrapping is allowed so values like 1.5 and -0.25 are applicable.
rightX_TexCoord The right x percentage ending point of the section of image that is desired to be drawn. 0.0 means the far left of the texture, 1.0 means the far right, 0.5 means the middle. Texture wrapping is allowed so values like 1.5 and -0.25 are applicable.
lowerY_TexCoord The lower y percentage starting point of the section of image that is desired to be drawn. 0.0 means the bottom of the texture, 1.0 means the top, 0.5 means the middle. Texture wrapping is allowed so values like 1.5 and -0.25 are applicable.
upperY_TexCoord The upper y percentage ending point of the section of image that is desired to be drawn. 0.0 means the bottom of the texture, 1.0 means the top, 0.5 means the middle. Texture wrapping is allowed so values like 1.5 and -0.25 are applicable.

void ResourceMgr::drawImage ( string  alias,
double  angle,
double  leftX,
double  rightX,
double  lowerY,
double  upperY 
)

Draws an image on the screen to the given coordinates and rotated by a given angle.

Draws an image that cooresponds to the given alias in the rectangle specified by the given coordinates and rotated by the given angle amount. The image will stretch to fit the rectangle.

Parameters:
alias The alias that cooresponds the desired image to draw.
angle The angle amount the image will be rotated. Expressed in degrees.
leftX The left x coordinate of the rectangle the image will be drawn in.
rightX The right x coordinate of the rectangle the image will be drawn in.
lowerY The lower y coordinate of the rectangle the image will be drawn in.
upperY The upper y coordinate of the rectangle the image will be drawn in.

void ResourceMgr::drawImage ( string  alias,
double  leftX,
double  rightX,
double  lowerY,
double  upperY 
)

Draws an image on the screen to the given coordinates.

Draws an image that cooresponds to the given alias in the rectangle specified by the given coordinates. The image will stretch to fit the rectangle.

Parameters:
alias The alias that cooresponds the desired image to draw.
leftX The left x coordinate of the rectangle the image will be drawn in.
rightX The right x coordinate of the rectangle the image will be drawn in.
lowerY The lower y coordinate of the rectangle the image will be drawn in.
upperY The upper y coordinate of the rectangle the image will be drawn in.

void ResourceMgr::drawImageOverlay ( string  alias,
double  angle,
double  leftX,
double  rightX,
double  lowerY,
double  upperY,
double  leftX_TexCoord,
double  rightX_TexCoord,
double  lowerY_TexCoord,
double  upperY_TexCoord 
)

Draws a section of an image on the screen to secific screen values and being rotated.

Draws a section of an image that cooresponds to the given alias in the rectangle specified by the given window percentage coordinates and rotated by a given angle amount. The image will stretch to fit the rectangle. The way the section of image is secified is through percentages along the x and y coordinates of the image. The image will be in the same spot regardless the coordinate system that is being used. Suggested use for this would thinks like user interfaces and stats.

Parameters:
alias The alias that cooresponds the desired image to draw.
angle The angle amount to rotate the image expressed in degrees.
percentageLeftX The left x percentage of the screen the image will be drawn in.
percentageRightX The right x percentage of the screen the image will be drawn in.
percentageLowerY The lower y percentage of the screen the image will be drawn in.
percentageUpperY The upper y percentage of the screen the image will be drawn in.
leftX_TexCoord The left x percentage starting point of the section of image that is desired to be drawn. 0.0 means the far left of the texture, 1.0 means the far right, 0.5 means the middle. Texture wrapping is allowed so values like 1.5 and -0.25 are applicable.
rightX_TexCoord The right x percentage ending point of the section of image that is desired to be drawn. 0.0 means the far left of the texture, 1.0 means the far right, 0.5 means the middle. Texture wrapping is allowed so values like 1.5 and -0.25 are applicable.
lowerY_TexCoord The lower y percentage starting point of the section of image that is desired to be drawn. 0.0 means the bottom of the texture, 1.0 means the top, 0.5 means the middle. Texture wrapping is allowed so values like 1.5 and -0.25 are applicable.
upperY_TexCoord The upper y percentage ending point of the section of image that is desired to be drawn. 0.0 means the bottom of the texture, 1.0 means the top, 0.5 means the middle. Texture wrapping is allowed so values like 1.5 and -0.25 are applicable.

void ResourceMgr::drawImageOverlay ( string  alias,
double  leftX,
double  rightX,
double  leftY,
double  upperY,
double  leftX_TexCoord,
double  rightX_TexCoord,
double  lowerY_TexCoord,
double  upperY_TexCoord 
)

Draws a section of an image on the screen to secific screen values.

Draws a section of an image that cooresponds to the given alias in the rectangle specified by the given window percentage coordinates. The image will stretch to fit the rectangle. The way the section of image is secified is through percentages along the x and y coordinates of the image. The image will be in the same spot regardless the coordinate system that is being used. Suggested use for this would thinks like user interfaces and stats.

Parameters:
alias The alias that cooresponds the desired image to draw.
percentageLeftX The left x percentage of the screen the image will be drawn in.
percentageRightX The right x percentage of the screen the image will be drawn in.
percentageLowerY The lower y percentage of the screen the image will be drawn in.
percentageUpperY The upper y percentage of the screen the image will be drawn in.
leftX_TexCoord The left x percentage starting point of the section of image that is desired to be drawn. 0.0 means the far left of the texture, 1.0 means the far right, 0.5 means the middle. Texture wrapping is allowed so values like 1.5 and -0.25 are applicable.
rightX_TexCoord The right x percentage ending point of the section of image that is desired to be drawn. 0.0 means the far left of the texture, 1.0 means the far right, 0.5 means the middle. Texture wrapping is allowed so values like 1.5 and -0.25 are applicable.
lowerY_TexCoord The lower y percentage starting point of the section of image that is desired to be drawn. 0.0 means the bottom of the texture, 1.0 means the top, 0.5 means the middle. Texture wrapping is allowed so values like 1.5 and -0.25 are applicable.
upperY_TexCoord The upper y percentage ending point of the section of image that is desired to be drawn. 0.0 means the bottom of the texture, 1.0 means the top, 0.5 means the middle. Texture wrapping is allowed so values like 1.5 and -0.25 are applicable.

void ResourceMgr::drawText ( string  alias,
double  numText,
double  x,
double  y 
)

Draws a double to the screen starting at specified values.

Draws the double to the screen with the lower left starting point of the text provided.

Parameters:
alias The reference name of the font previously loaded.
numText The double that is desired to be outputted to the screen.
x The left x starting point of where the text will be drawn from.
y The lower y starting point of where the text will be drawn from.

void ResourceMgr::drawText ( string  alias,
unsigned int  numText,
double  x,
double  y 
)

Draws an unsigned integer to the screen starting at specified values.

Draws the unsigned integer to the screen with the lower left starting point of the text provided.

Parameters:

numText The unsigned integer that is desired to be outputted to the screen.
x The left x starting point of where the text will be drawn from.
y The lower y starting point of where the text will be drawn from.

void ResourceMgr::drawText ( string  alias,
string  text,
double  x,
double  y 
)

Parameters:
alias The reference name of the font previously loaded.
text The string of characters that is desired to be outputted to the screen.
x The left x starting point of where the text will be drawn from.
y The lower y starting point of where the text will be drawn from.

void ResourceMgr::drawTextOverlay ( string  alias,
double  numText,
double  percentX,
double  percentY 
)

Draws a double to the screen starting at specified screen percentages.

Draws the double to the screen with the lower left starting point percentage of the screen to begin drawing the text. The text will be drawin in the same spot regardless the coordinate system.

Parameters:
alias The reference name of the font previously loaded.
numText The double that is desired to be outputted to the screen.
percentX The left x percentage of the screen where the text will be drawn from. Values range from 0.0 to 1.0. 0.0 is the left side of the screen. 1.0 is the right side.
y The lower y starting point of where the text will be drawn from.

void ResourceMgr::drawTextOverlay ( string  alias,
unsigned int  numText,
double  percentX,
double  percentY 
)

Draws an unsigned integer to the screen starting at specified screen percentages.

Draws the unsigned integer to the screen with the lower left starting point percentage of the screen to begin drawing the text. The text will be drawin in the same spot regardless the coordinate system.

Parameters:
alias The reference name of the font previously loaded.
numText The unsigned integer that is desired to be outputted to the screen.
percentX The left x percentage of the screen where the text will be drawn from. Values range from 0.0 to 1.0. 0.0 is the left side of the screen. 1.0 is the right side.
y The lower y starting point of where the text will be drawn from.

void ResourceMgr::fadeOutMusic ( int  miliSecs  ) 

Fades out music over a given time.

Will fade out any music playing over the time of the given amount of miliseconds.

Parameters:
miliSecs The number of miliseconds it takes to fully fade out the music playing.

ResourceMgr * ResourceMgr::getInstance (  )  [static]

Gets the instance of the ResourceMgr object.

Use this to obtain the instance of the ResourceMgr object.

Returns:
ResourceMgr* A pointer to the instance of the ResourceMgr object.

void ResourceMgr::loadFont ( string  filename,
string  alias,
int  size 
)

Loads an font file.

Loads an font file into memory so that it can be drawn later. This can be a TTF or RTF file.

Parameters:
filename The exact location of the font file. Can use a reference or a direct location as a location for the file. Example: "./fonts/arial.ttf" Means the file will be found in the running directory under the folder "fonts".
alias The name that will be used to reference the font later when wanting to draw text with it.

void ResourceMgr::loadImage ( string  filename,
string  alias 
)

Loads an image file.

Loads an image file into memory so that it can be drawn later. This can be a BMP, JPEG, GIF, PNG, TIFF, TGA filetype.

Parameters:
filename The exact location of the image file. Can use a reference or a direct location as a location for the file. Example: "./images/background.png" Means the file will be found in the running directory under the folder "images".
alias The name that will be used to reference the image later when wanting to draw it.

void ResourceMgr::loadMusic ( string  filename,
string  alias 
)

Loads a music file.

Loads a music file into memory so that it can be played later. This can be a WAV, MP3, OGG, MIDI, and MOD files. Suggested not to use MP3's since there can be some problems with these files during playback.

Parameters:
filename The exact location of the music file. Can use a reference or a direct location as a location for the file. Example: "./music/backgroundmusic.ogg" Means the file will be found in the running directory under the folder "music".
alias The name that will be used to reference the music later when wanting to play it back.

void ResourceMgr::loadSound ( string  filename,
string  alias 
)

Loads a sound file.

Loads a sound file into memory so that it can be played later. This should only be a WAV file.

Parameters:
filename The exact location of the WAV file. Can use a reference or a direct location as a location for the file. Example: "./sounds/boom.wav" Means the file will be found in the running directory under the folder "sounds".
alias The name that will be used to reference the sound later when wanting to play it back.

void ResourceMgr::pauseMusic (  ) 

Pauses any music playing.

Will pause any music currently playing. A subsequent call resumeMusic will replay the song where you paused it.

void ResourceMgr::playMusic ( string  alias  ) 

Plays a music file.

Plays a music file that is referenced with the given alias. Will play this music file one play through and stop.

Parameters:
alias The name that references the music file. Should match the alias that was passed in during loadMusic for that music.

void ResourceMgr::playMusicFade ( string  alias,
int  numLoops,
int  miliSecs 
)

Fades in a music file that plays multiple times.

Fades in a music file that is referenced with the given alias. Will play this music file as many of times as the number given into the function.

Parameters:
alias The name that references the music file. Should match the alias that was passed in during loadMusic for that music.
numLoops The number of times to play the song. 0 does not play it, 2 plays it 2 times, -1 plays it forever until the song is stopped or paused.
miliSecs How many miliseconds it takes to fade into the song. At the end of that time, the music should be at full volume.

void ResourceMgr::playMusicFadeFrom ( string  alias,
int  numLoops,
double  position,
int  miliSecs 
)

Plays a music file multiple times while starting from a.

given position and fading in.

Plays a music file that is referenced with the given alias. The song will start at a given amount of seconds into the song while fading in for a given amount of miliseconds. Will play this music file as many of times as the number given into the function.

Parameters:
alias The name that references the music file. Should match the alias that was passed in during loadMusic for that music.
numLoops The number of times to play the song. 0 does not play it, 2 plays it 2 times, -1 plays it forever until the song is stopped or paused.
position The number of seconds into the song to start playing from.
miliSecs How many miliseconds it takes to fade into the song. At the end of that time, the music should be at full volume.

void ResourceMgr::playMusicFrom ( string  alias,
int  numLoops,
double  position 
)

Plays a music file multiple times while starting from a given position.

Plays a music file that is referenced with the given alias. The song will start at a given amount of seconds into the song. Will play this music file as many of times as the number given into the function.

Parameters:
alias The name that references the music file. Should match the alias that was passed in during loadMusic for that music.
numLoops The number of times to play the song. 0 does not play it, 2 plays it 2 times, -1 plays it forever until the song is stopped or paused.
position The number of seconds into the song to start playing from.

void ResourceMgr::playMusicRepeat ( string  alias,
int  numLoops 
)

Plays a music file multiple times.

Plays a music file that is referenced with the given alias. Will play this music file as many of times as the number given into the function.

Parameters:
alias The name that references the music file. Should match the alias that was passed in during loadMusic for that music.
numLoops The number of times to play the song. 0 does not play it, 2 plays it 2 times, -1 plays it forever until the song is stopped or paused.

void ResourceMgr::playSound ( string  alias  ) 

Plays a sound at full volume through all speakers.

Plays the sound that identifies with the alias given through all the speakers at full volume.

Parameters:
alias The name that references the sounds file. Should match the alias that was passed in during loadSound for that sound.

void ResourceMgr::playSound3D ( string  alias,
double  xEar,
double  yEar,
double  xSrc,
double  ySrc 
)

Plays a sound through the speakers at a given location.

Plays a sound through the speakers with the correct volume and location that matches the ear and location of the sound. Sounds that come from the left side of the ear will come through mostly the left speaker. The farther away a sound is from the ear, the fainter the sound will be.

Parameters:
alias The name that references the sound file. Should match the alias that was passed in during loadSound for that sound.
xEar The x location of the listening ear.
yEar The y location of the listening ear.
xSrc The x location of where the sound is originating from.
ySrc The y location of where the sound is originating from.

void ResourceMgr::release (  ) 

Releases the instance of the ResourceMgr object obtained.

Release the instance of the ResourceMgr obtained from getInstance(). This must be called on the pointer obtained from getInstance() to ensure that no memory leaks occur and that the ResourceMgr object is destroyed when nobody has an instance of the object.

void ResourceMgr::resumeMusic (  ) 

Resumes any paused music.

Will resume any music that was paused. Calling this on non-paused music does nothing.

void ResourceMgr::setMaxFullHearDistance ( double  distance  ) 

Sets the maximum distance that a sound is still heard at full volume.

Sets the maximum distance that a sound can be while still being able to hear it at full volume. Anything closer than that distance is still heard at full volume. Everything futher than this distance will sound fainter the farther it is away.

void ResourceMgr::setMaxSoundDistance ( double  distance  ) 

Sets the maximum distance to where 3D sound is heard.

Sets the maximum distance a sound can be playing while still being heard. The closer a sound is to the given distance, the fainter it sounds. If the sound is at or farther than the distance given, that sound will not be heard.

This only effects when you use playSound3D

Parameters:
distance The maximum amount of distance that 3D sounds can be heard.

void ResourceMgr::stopMusic (  ) 

Stops any playing music.

Will stop any music currently playing. Once stopped the song cannot be started again unless using playMusic or any of its counterparts that do fading and looping.
